panels.description: The status of Kafka Streams application.
panels.title: Application status

panels.description: The ID of Kafka Streams application.
panels.title: Application ID

panels.description: The version of Kafka Streams library.
panels.title: Kafka version

panels.description: The total number of stream instances.
panels.title: Total stream instances

panels.description: The total number of stream threads.
panels.title: Total stream threads

panels.description: The total number of failed stream threads.
panels.title: Failed stream threads

panels.description: The total number of running thread tasks.
panels.title: Running thread tasks

panels.description: The state of stream instances over time.
panels.title: Stream instance state over time

panels.description: The status of stream threads over time.
panels.title: Stream thread status over time

panels.description: The per-second number of operations performed by the stream thread.
panels.title: Stream thread operations per second

panels.description: The average time in nanoseconds taken by the stream thread to perform an operation.
panels.title: Stream thread latency

panels.description: The average number of records polled/processed in one iteration.
panels.title: Records polled/processed per iteration

panels.description: The approximate space size in bytes used by the state store.
panels.title: State store space size

panels.description: The per-second number of operations performed by the state store.
panels.title: State store operations per second

panels.description: The average time in nanoseconds taken by the state store to perform an operation.
panels.title: State store latency

panels.description: Statistics of stream consumers for topics.

targets.expr: min(label_join(kafka_consumer_fetch_manager_records_consumed_total{job="$job", instance=~".*$server.*", clientId=~".+", topic=~".+"}, "clientIdAndTopic", "-", "clientId", "topic")) by (clientIdAndTopic, clientId, topic)

min(label_join(kafka_consumer_fetch_manager_bytes_consumed_total{job="$job", instance=~".*$server.*", clientId=~".+", topic=~".+"}, "clientIdAndTopic", "-", "clientId", "topic")) by (clientIdAndTopic, clientId, topic)

panels.title: Consumers

panels.description: The number of records consumed per second.
panels.title: Records consumed per second

panels.description: The number of records in bytes consumed per second.
panels.title: Records in bytes consumed per second

panels.description: The lag in terms of number of records by clients. An increasing value over time is your best indication that the consumer group is not keeping up with the producers.
panels.title: Consumer lag

panels.description: Statistics of stream producers for topics.

targets.expr: min(label_join(kafka_producer_topic_record_send_total{job="$job", instance=~".*$server.*", clientId=~".+", topic=~".+"}, "clientIdAndTopic", "-", "clientId", "topic")) by (clientIdAndTopic, clientId, topic)
min(label_join(kafka_producer_topic_byte_total{job="$job", instance=~".*$server.*", clientId=~".+", topic=~".+"}, "clientIdAndTopic", "-", "clientId", "topic")) by (clientIdAndTopic, clientId, topic)

panels.title: Producers

panels.description: The number of records sent per second.
panels.title: Records sent per second

panels.description: The number of records in bytes sent per second.
panels.title: Records in bytes sent per second

panels.description: The average time in milliseconds record batches spent in the send buffer.
panels.title: Producer record queue time

panels.description: The information about CPU usage.
panels.title: CPU usage [$server]

panels.description: The information about JVM threads.
panels.title: Threads [$server]

panels.description: The information about JVM heap memory usage.
panels.title: Heap memory usage [$server]

panels.description: The number of garbage collections triggered per second.
panels.title: Garbage collections triggered per second [$server]

panels.description: The information about JVM heap memory usage in percent (%).

targets.expr: 100 * jvm_memory_bytes_used{area="heap", job="$job", instance=~".*$server.*"} / jvm_memory_bytes_max{area="heap", job="$job", instance=~".*$server.*"}

panels.title: Heap memory usage in percent [$server]

panels.description: The time in seconds spent in garbage collection.
panels.title: Time spent in garbage collection [$server]
